Indeed, constitutive processing of p105 to p50 occurs at a higher rate in cells lacking GSK-3 beta with respect to wild-type cells and can be reduced upon reintroduction of GSK-3 beta by transfection. These data suggest that (i) prephosphorylation of tau by A-kinase makes additional and different sites accessible for phosphorylation by GSK-3; (ii) phosphorylation of tau at these additional sites further inhibits the biological activity of tau in its ability to bind to microtubules and promote microtubule assembly.

Evidence: Normally, cytoplasmic beta-catenin associates with APC and axin and is continuously phosphorylated by GSK-3beta, marking it for proteasomal degradation.

Evidence: Normally, cytoplasmic beta-catenin associates with APC and axin and is continuously phosphorylated by GSK-3beta, marking it for proteasomal degradation.

Evidence: APC acts as a scaffold, binding beta-catenin and recruiting CK1alpha and GSK3beta to phosphorylate beta-catenin.

Evidence: In the absence of Wnt signaling, beta-catenin is constitutively phosphorylated by GSK-3beta.

Subject: p(HGNC:GSK3B)

Evidence: Gsk3beta was shown to phosphorylate at ser-493 in vitro by phosphopeptide mapping and site-directed mutagenesis, and in vivo in hek293 cells. The role of ser-493 phosphorylation is also a question to be addressed in the future. Because the e-segment appears to be involved in filament formation (27, 42), phosphorylation in that region may also play a regulatory role in filament formation. Secondary structure prediction suggests that phosphorylation of ser-493 in combination with following the pro residue interrupts _-helix of the e-segment

Evidence: Gsk3 was previously shown to directly phosphorylate the n-terminal regulatory domain of nfatc1, thus antagonizing the action of calcineurin and inhibiting nuclear shuttling of nfat.
Subject: p(HGNC:GSK3B)

Evidence: We find that in the presence but not the absence of EC, NFAT1 can be detected in the nuclei of CsA treated T cells within 8 h of triggering, reaching a maximal level of 60% of control by 24 h. Glycogen synthase kinase-3beta (GSK-3beta), which rephosphorylates NFAT and promotes nuclear export, is inhibited by EC costimulation.
Subject: p(HGNC:GSK3B)

Evidence: In the nucleus, GSK3beta phosphorylates NFAT, thereby promoting its nuclear export [XREF_BIBR].
Subject: p(HGNC:GSK3B)

Evidence: It is reported that Akt activates NFAT by phosphorylating and inactivating glycogen synthase kinase-3 beta, which phosphorylates NFAT and inhibits its nuclear import and DNA binding ().
Subject: p(HGNC:GSK3B)

Evidence: We find that in the presence but not the absence of EC, NFAT1 can be detected in the nuclei of CsA treated T cells within 8 h of triggering, reaching a maximal level of 60% of control by 24 h. Glycogen synthase kinase-3beta (GSK-3beta), which rephosphorylates NFAT and promotes nuclear export, is inhibited by EC costimulation.
Subject: p(HGNC:GSK3B)

Evidence: Glycogen synthase kinase 3 regulates expression of nuclear factor-erythroid-2 related transcription factor-1 (nrf1) and inhibits pro-survival function of nrf1
Subject: p(HGNC:GSK3B)

Evidence: Interestingly, a recent study demonstrated that NRF2 is phosphorylated by GSK3beta in the central Neh6 domain (DSGIS, residues 334-338), creating an SCF BTRC destruction motif similar to that of beta-catenin (XREF_BIBR).
Subject: p(HGNC:GSK3B)

Evidence: Indeed, phosphatase treatment resulted in the disappearance of the slowest migrating Nrf2 species (Supplemental Figure S1B), which is consistent with previous reports suggesting that Nrf2 is phosphorylated by PKC, GSK-3beta, CK2, and JNK (XREF_BIBR; XREF_BIBR; XREF_BIBR; XREF_BIBR).
Subject: p(HGNC:GSK3B)

Evidence: Nrf2 is also phosphorylated by GSK3beta at Ser335, Ser338, Ser342, and Ser347 in the Neh6 domain, creating a phosphodegron to which beta-TrCP is recruited.
Subject: p(HGNC:GSK3B)

Evidence: Specifically, it has been shown that GSK-3beta mediates phosphorylation of certain serine residues on the Neh6 domain of Nrf2, increasing its affinity for another E3 ubiquitin ligase, beta-TrCP, which is believed to mediate Nrf2 ubiquitination and proteasomal degradation XREF_BIBR.
Subject: p(HGNC:GSK3B)

Evidence: Additionally GSK-3beta phosphorylates p105 at serine 903 and 907 which primes p105 for proteolytic degradation in response to TNFalpha stimulation () ().
Subject: p(HGNC:GSK3B)

Evidence: Accordingly it has been shown that GSK-3beta phosphorylate p105 precursor of the NF-kappaB p50 subunit and this in turn promote TNF-alpha induced phosphorylation and degradation of IkappaB by the IkappaB kinase (IKK), thereby, GSK-3beta regulates the promoter specific recruitment of NF-kappaB, and by this means it plays an essential role in gene transcription.
Subject: p(HGNC:GSK3B)

Evidence: GSK-3 beta forms an in vivo complex with and specifically phosphorylates NF-kappa B1/p105 at Ser-903 and Ser-907 in vitro. GSK-3 beta has a dual effect on p105: it stabilizes p105 under resting conditions and primes p105 for degradation upon tumor necrosis factor (TNF)-alpha treatment. Indeed, constitutive processing of p105 to p50 occurs at a higher rate in cells lacking GSK-3 beta with respect to wild-type cells and can be reduced upon reintroduction of GSK-3 beta by transfection. S903A and S907A point mutations impair p105 proteolysis in response to TNF-α.
Subject: p(HGNC:GSK3B)

Evidence: Additionally GSK-3beta phosphorylates p105 at serine 903 and 907 which primes p105 for proteolytic degradation in response to TNFalpha stimulation () ().
Subject: p(HGNC:GSK3B)

Indeed, constitutive processing of p105 to p50 occurs at a higher rate in cells lacking GSK-3 beta with respect to wild-type cells and can be reduced upon reintroduction of GSK-3 beta by transfection. S903A and S907A point mutations impair p105 proteolysis in response to TNF-α.
Subject: p(HGNC:GSK3B)

Evidence: Our data suggests that a pool of p100 is constitutively phosphorylated by GSK3beta, ubiquitinated by Fbw7 and degraded independently of stimulation of the NF-kappaB pathway.
Subject: p(HGNC:GSK3B)

Evidence: We may speculate that GSK-3beta may phosphorylate IkappaBalpha to release p65 and p50 into the nucleus to affect target gene expression because IkappaBalpha may be phosphorylated by GSK-3beta, as previously proposed (XREF_BIBR).
Subject: p(HGNC:GSK3B)

Evidence: We may speculate that GSK-3beta may phosphorylate IkappaBalpha to release p65 and p50 into the nucleus to affect target gene expression because IkappaBalpha may be phosphorylated by GSK-3beta, as previously proposed (XREF_BIBR).
Subject: p(HGNC:GSK3B)

Evidence: It was postulated that GSK-3beta phosphorylates IkappaBalpha directly and, this way, induces its degradation XREF_BIBR.
Subject: p(HGNC:GSK3B)

Evidence: Our research showed that hNinein is possibly phosphorylated by PKA, Aurora A and GSK3beta.
Subject: p(HGNC:GSK3B)

Evidence: Using a kinase assay, AIBp interacts with the Aurora-A kinase domain functions as a positive regulator, whereas AIBp binding to hNinein appears to block the phosphorylation of hNinein by both Aurora-A and GSK3beta.
Subject: p(HGNC:GSK3B)

Evidence: In kinase assay, CGI-99 binds to hNinein and completely blocks the phosphorylation of hNinein by GSK3beta.
Subject: p(HGNC:GSK3B)

Evidence: Here, we observed that gsk3beta was able to bind and phosphorylate notch1ic in vitro, and attenuation of gsk3beta activity reduced phosphorylation of notchic in vivo.Functionally, ligand-activated signaling through the endogenous notch1 receptor was reduced in gsk3beta fibroblasts, implying a positive role for gsk3beta in mammalian notch signaling.
Subject: p(HGNC:GSK3B)

Evidence: In this study, we show that GSK-3 beta is able to bind and phosphorylate Notch2 in vitro and in vivo.
Subject: p(HGNC:GSK3B)

Evidence: We show that gsk-3beta directly binds at c-terminal of the notch2 ankyrin repeats and phosphorylates thr-2068 and/or ser-2070, thr-2074, and thr-2093.
Subject: p(HGNC:GSK3B)

Evidence: No evidence text.
Subject: p(HGNC:GSK3B)

Evidence: Ser-2093 is efficiently phosphorylated by GSK-3β and, to a minor extent, residues Thr-2068 and/or Ser-2070 and Thr-2074 of Notch2 are also targets for GSK-3β-dependent phosphorylation. We also find that GSK-3β-dependent phosphorylation of Notch2 is inhibiting transcriptional activation of different Notch target genes.
